main event: A bright light was sighted hovering over the highway near Billings, Oklahoma on March 6, 1969.
interesting points: The light appeared to be circular in shape and was first observed in the northwest, where it remained stationary for a short period of time.
The light then began to move rapidly to the east, south, west and back to the north, disappearing and reappearing at various intervals during its movements.
The light was described as being very bright and illuminating the surrounding countryside.
The observer was driving home from work when he sighted the object, and reduced his speed to get a better view.
No sound was associated with the object, and the observer was unable to estimate its size due to the distance.
